quiz.title: Algebra 1 Review: Quiz 8
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1.8: Solving Quadratic Equations (Factoring, Square Roots)
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Quadratic Equations via Factoring and Square Root Methods

questions.question: Solve the equation using the Zero Product Property: $(x - 7)(x + 3) = 0$.
questions.explanation: Set each factor to zero: $x - 7 = 0 \Rightarrow x = 7$ and $x + 3 = 0 \Rightarrow x = -3$.

questions.question: Solve for $x$: $x^2 - 64 = 0$.
questions.explanation: $x^2 = 64$. Taking the square root of both sides gives $x = \pm \sqrt{64}$, so $x = 8$ or $x = -8$.

questions.question: Solve by factoring: $x^2 - 5x - 6 = 0$.
questions.explanation: Factor the trinomial: $(x - 6)(x + 1) = 0$. Solutions are $x = 6$ and $x = -1$.

questions.question: Solve the equation using square roots: $2x^2 = 50$.
questions.explanation: Divide by 2: $x^2 = 25$. Take the square root: $x = \pm 5$.

questions.question: What are the roots of the equation $x^2 + 10x + 25 = 0$?
questions.explanation: Factor as a perfect square trinomial: $(x + 5)^2 = 0$. Thus, $x + 5 = 0$, leading to $x = -5$.

questions.question: Solve for $x$: $3x^2 - 27 = 0$.
questions.explanation: $3x^2 = 27 \Rightarrow x^2 = 9$. Taking the square root gives $x = \pm 3$.

questions.question: Solve by factoring: $x^2 + 8x = 0$.
questions.explanation: Factor out the GCF: $x(x + 8) = 0$. Set each factor to zero: $x = 0$ and $x = -8$.

questions.question: Find the solutions to $(x + 4)^2 = 49$.
questions.explanation: Take the square root: $x + 4 = \pm 7$. Case 1: $x + 4 = 7 \Rightarrow x = 3$. Case 2: $x + 4 = -7 \Rightarrow x = -11$.

questions.question: Solve: $2x^2 - 14x = 0$.
questions.explanation: Factor out $2x$: $2x(x - 7) = 0$. The solutions are $x = 0$ and $x = 7$.

questions.question: An object is dropped from a height of 144 feet. Its height is modeled by $h = -16t^2 + 144$. How many seconds $t$ does it take to hit the ground ($h = 0$)?
questions.explanation: $0 = -16t^2 + 144 \Rightarrow 16t^2 = 144 \Rightarrow t^2 = 9$. Since time must be positive, $t = 3$ seconds.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have a firm grasp of solving quadratics using both factoring and square root properties.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember to include both the positive and negative roots when taking square roots of both sides.
scoreMessages.50: Decent work. Practice identifying when to use GCF factoring versus trinomial factoring.
scoreMessages.0: Review the Zero Product Property and basic square root equations to improve your score.
